"Date range" widget
"Date range" is a tool that allows the user to set a period of time, specifying its start and end.
The data displayed by the
widget
can be used by the business analyst as parameters for subsequent configuration of the business logic of the System module being developed.
Example of a customized widget for a payment schedule:
Setting up
The widget is added in the
visual of an instance
editing mode. It is necessary to drag (Drag-and-drop) the "Date range" widget from the "Widgets" tab of the "Elements" panel from the "User Information" section to the workspace of the object profile.
By clicking on the
button, a modal window with a set of widget settings will be opened opens.
Parameters
Setting
Purpose
Attribute with start/end date (with start/end date and time)
Selecting the attribute type that defines the value of the start/end date. The following types of attributes will be available for selecting, including parent attributes:
"Date";
"Date and time".
Placeholder for the start/end date
Enter the text that will be displayed as a hint inside the start/end date input field.
Symbol before the start/end date
Enter a character or text to be displayed before the start/end date.
After filling in the parameters to save the changes, click on the
button. The settings will be applied after saving the
visual
. After that, working with the added widget will be available from the object profile.
Depending on the type of the selected value of the "Attribute with start date" and "Attribute with end date" parameters, the widget display can take the following form:
Widget with "Date" value type.
Widget with "Date and type" value type.
Parameter attributes can be of different types. For example, for the
"Attribute with start date"
parameter, an attribute of the "Date" type can be selected, for the
"Attribute with end date"
parameter — "Date and Time".
The date range can be set manually by entering numeric values in the widget fields or using the calendar available after clicking on the
icon.
In the calendar, select the
start date
from which the data should be displayed and, optionally, the
end date
, since the end value for displaying the data may not be set or set later.
To change the month, click on the date, and then it will be possible to select the month. The year is set similarly to the month. Learn more about
working with DateTime attribute
.
Widget fields can be filled in by default if the values of the attributes involved in the setting are not empty.
The widget automatically sets time limits, checking the fulfillment of compliance with the condition: "The start date is less than or equal to End date".
The date range can also be set by clicking on the "Today" and "Now" buttons for each of the dates.
By clicking the button:
"Today" — the current date is set in the calendar. Available for an attribute with the "Date" or "Date and Time" value types;
"Now" — the current time is set in the timer. Available for an attribute with the "Date and Time" value type.
When setting the end date by clicking on "Now", the start date will be automatically reset to zero.
The time must not be set to a value greater than 23:59. The value 00:00 is used to determine midnight.
Saving the set date range is done by clicking on the "Done" button.
Use case

4. Drag-and-drop the "Date range" widget and the "Payments" child attribute to the visual.
5. Configure the "Date Range" widget by filling in the parameters.
Set the time interval and click on the "Done" button.
6. For the "Payments" type registry it is necessary to add a filter condition, which will be implemented by comparing the value of the "Payment date" attribute with the values of the "Start date" and "End date" attributes of the main object type "Application for credit", which are, in turn, set using the widget "Date range".
To do this, in the "Payments"
registry
type, by clicking on the
button, it will be possible to configure the registry. On the "Filtering and search filters" tab, in the "Data filtering algorithm" field, open the actions menu and select "Add".
In the profile that opens, specify the parameters in the "General information" block:
"The object type with elements to be filtered" (set by the System by default);
"Object profile with parameters to be used for filter (parent object)".
Next, add a filtering algorithm in the "Filter condition" block..
See more about configuring the filtering algorithm.
It is necessary to add a condition to the filtering algorithm, which consists of two subconditions connected with the and operator. The subcondition consists of comparing the left part (attribute value), the operator and the right part (parameter).

7. Save the changes by clicking "Save" and "OK" on the "Elements" panel.
After that, the object profile will display a payment schedule with the ability to display records of payments according to the specified time interval.
